messages.message: btw I noticed in the docs that scan_below doesn’t actually have a left_pos and right_pos field. are we trying not to support that, or is it just an effect of not explicitly defining it in the function signature in python?
there is a left_pad and right_pad, maybe that’s what you want?
i’d imagine in most cases, the “below” is implying the left and right pos, by using a shorthand for “take the left pos of the first character and the right pos of the last character matched”
yup ^ is correct. we could add it but might complicate the interface for no difference in functionality

haha maybe i’ve just been using it wrong then. I think a lot of times, i scan below a regex, so i’m not too sure about the actual width of the scan_below, but i do know the left and right positions, so I always set those instead

yea i’ll often do something weird with `left_pos` and `right_pos` functions and the same regex as `scan_below`  in a different column so that based on the width / other columns in the table, i can put in some other logic.
